description.en: The seminar deals with German language literary texts from the beginning of the twentieth century to our days, introducing to some of the key authors such as Thomas Mann, Rilke, Kafka, Celan, Grass, Dürrenmatt, Böll, Handke and Sebald. The course will concentrate on close reading techniques and hermeneutics and focus on the discussion and analysis of selected literary works. Even though it cannot provide a comprehensive history of literature, it will proceed chronologically to enable the students to better understand the historical basis and development of literary forms and topics.
description.et: Kursusel käsitletakse saksakeelseid kirjanduslikke tekste, mis on kirjutatud alates 20. sajandist. Kursus keskendub sellistele autoritele nagu Thomas Mann, Rilke, Kafka, Celan, Grass, Dürrenmatt, Böll, Handke ja Sebald. Seminaris keskendutakse lugemistehnikatele ja hermeneutikale ning valitud kirjandusteoste analüüsile.

objectives.en: The course will give the students an overview over the German speaking literature of the 20th and 21st century covering many of the key authors. The crucial developments and topics will be dealt with, covering modernism, post-war literature, the divided and reunified Germany. The students will learn how to analyse different literary texts (prose, poetry and drama).
objectives.et:
Kursuse eesmärk on:
-anda üliõpilastele ülevaade saksakeelsest kirjandusest 20. ja 21.sajandil, keskendudes perioodidele nagu modernism, pärastsõjajärgne periood, kirjandus jagatud ja ühendatud Saksamaal.
- anda üliõpilastele oskused analüüsida erinevaid kirjanduslikke tekste (proosa, luule ja draama).

learning_outcomes.en: After the course, the students will be familiar with a good number of the most important authors and developments in German literary history form the beginning of the 20th century to our times. They will have become accustomed to literary concepts and have acquired skills how to discuss and critically analyse literature of different periods and genres, orally and in writing.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud tudengid tunnevad paljusid saksa kirjandusajaloo kõige tähtsamaid autoreid ja arenguid alates 20.sajandist kuni tänapäevani. Nad on omandanud oskuse diskuteerida ja kriitiliselt analüüsida erinevate perioodide ja žanrite kirjandust nii suuliselt kui kirjalikult.

learning_outcomes.en: They will have developed digital skills such as using search engines and data banks while being aware of their structure and operation modes so that they can critically evaluate the sources and their reliability. Furthermore, they have practised using various word processing functions and creating content in different formats.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilased on arendanud oma digioskusi otsingumootorite ja andmebaaside kasutamisel ning oskavad kriitiliselt hinnata allikaid ja nende usaldusväärsust. Nad on praktiseerinud mitmeid tekstitöötlusfunktsioone ja loonud erinevaid tekstisorte.

notes.et: Kursuse toimumist toetab Tartu Ülikooli ASTRA projekt PER ASPERA, finantseerib Euroopa Liidu Regionaalarengu Fond/The course is supported by the University of Tartu ASTRA Project PER ASPERA, financed by the (European Union) European Regional Development Fund.

grade_preconditions.et:
Active participation
One presentation in class
One final essay (2000 words)

grade_evaluation.et:
1)	Active participation: attendance of 75% of the course is a precondition for passing and contribution in class counts for 25% of the mark.
2)	One presentation in class: counts for 25% of the mark.
3)	One final essay (2000 words) counts for 50 % of the mark.

assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
